about.p1: Study Whiz AI is a homework solver app, but not one that does your tasks for you. It is not about shortcuts, but about learning smarter. A smart study assistant that patiently explains each step, guides your thinking, and helps you truly understand every lesson.
about.p2:
Before becoming product developers, we were once curious students, eager to learn and eager to play, who spent hours struggling with tough homework. We understand that everyone learns differently, and no one should be forced to follow a single way of learning.
From that experience, Study Whiz AI was born as a smart study assistant that stays by your side, helping you understand lessons in the way that suits you best.
Not to do the work for you, but to turn hard problems into opportunities to learn smarter.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Does Study Whiz AI solve all exercises for you?
faq.a1: No. Study Whiz AI is designed to support your learning process. When you enter an exercise, the AI system analyzes the question, suggests possible solution approaches, explains each step, and provides reference answers when available. The main goal is to help you understand the underlying concepts and problem-solving methods, so you can apply them independently to similar exercises.
faq.q2: Is using Study Whiz AI to do homework considered cheating?
faq.a2: If you use Study Whiz AI as a learning tool to understand problem-solving methods, review your work, or explore new approaches that is a proper and legitimate use. However, if you copy the results generated by Study Whiz AI and submit them as your own work, especially in exams, assessments, or graded assignments, it may be considered academic misconduct under your school‚Äôs regulations.
faq.q3: Are my problem data saved or shared?
faq.a3: We may store parts of your query history and problem content to improve responses, helping the system learn and assist you better. This information is anonymized and encrypted, and is not stored with personally identifiable data unless necessary.
faq.q4: Does Study Whiz AI guarantee that all answers are always accurate?
faq.a4: No AI system can achieve 100% accuracy. The answers and explanations provided by the application are intended for support and reference purposes only and may contain errors or non-optimal solutions. You should use these results as a reference to compare, verify, and learn alongside your own work or official study materials.
faq.q5: Can I use the app during exams?
faq.a5: No. Study Whiz AI must not be used during exams, tests, or any form of official assessment without permission from your school or instructor. The purpose of the application is to help you learn and strengthen your knowledge, not to provide ‚Äúanswers for you‚Äù in testing situations.

s1.title: 1. Educational Purpose
s1.body:
The Application is designed to help students understand and master knowledge, not to replace the learning process.
By using the Application, you agree to use AI-generated results only for the following purposes:
s1.b2: To review and reinforce learned knowledge;
s1.b3: To enhance self-learning skills and critical thinking.

s2.title: 2. Commitment to Academic Integrity
s2.b1: Not submit AI-generated answers as their own academic work;
s2.b2: Not use AI-generated results to bypass or violate school anti-cheating policies;
s2.b3: Comply with academic integrity standards, exam regulations, and school rules.

s3.title: 3. Monitoring and Violation Handling
s3.body:
Schools or educational institutions may implement measures to detect and investigate academic misconduct related to AI use.
If a violation is identified, we reserve the right to:
s3.b1: Issue a warning, suspend, or terminate the user‚Äôs account;
s3.b2: Provide relevant information to educational authorities or institutions upon a lawful request.
s3.tail: Users who violate these terms shall be fully responsible under their school‚Äôs regulations (if applicable).

s4.title: 4. Encourage Responsible Use
s4.b1: Use AI as a personal tutor, not a proxy to do your work;
s4.b3: Learn actively‚Äîask questions and discuss, rather than relying on the machine.
